Comments_Questions: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course
How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work
How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
Comments_List: He wrote the book.
the topic of study was clearly defined. the course did bounce around a bit but I feel based on the syllabus I knew what to expect for each session
There was often confusion as to how much needed to be provided or adjusted regarding homework.

expectations were almost non existent. I found while trying to complete the final project, each week I brought something new but each week I questioned if what I was presenting was what was expected. I know I wasn't the only one questioning this as each one of my classmates came with totally varying degrees of work. everyone was unclear on the assignments.

Powerpoints were informative and interesting. Drawback was Eugene's seeming frustration with questions that took us away from presentations despite how great is insight's or stories were regarding the subject.

The professor would run out of time to finish his lectures sometimes, and would have to finish them at the beginning of next class. Our syllabus changed a couple of times due to this shifting in schedule.

the powerpoints were great. I feel that the professor has loads of information to pass on to the students. that being said. the class sessions were painful to sit through. the professor has a very very hard time verbalizing information and communicating it to others I understand that not many people are good at talking in front of groups of people and that's fine but then the professor should find other ways to convey information. 

that being said. there were moments where the professor was able to speak to us on a one on one basis. mostly when critiquing our weekly assignments, where I feel he was able to pass on mass amounts of info. most of which I wished he had talked about during lecture.
They were all within the boundaries of theater planning.
Would say "Good" if there hadn't been so much confusion as to what the requirements of the assignments were. I also got confused as to what I should or should not change when given feedback.
Responded to email.
I never needed to contact him other than a few emails, but he always responded promptly.
Assignments were directly correlated with the book and class work.

I will say after the final project I do know a little bit more about why theatres are designed the way they are and I now understand that there are codes that need to be followed. I also now see the struggle between maintaining sightlines and having an appropriate seating layout and balcony.

 beyond that. there wasn't much takeaway from this course
N/A
The course was interesting and undoubtedly will prepare me for my career.
Helped clarify code requirements within spaces and reinforce the first year TD&P safety course work regarding public spaces and theatrical venues.
this course doesn't really relate to production work. at least not in a way that was easily apparent to me.
He wrote the book and also has a wealth of real life experience with the subject matter.
the professor seems to know a great deal about the subject. however he needs to find new ways to effectively communicate the information to the students.

Eugene's visible frustration with clarifying questions or preparedness for class after setting an example of confusion actively worked against the learning environment. He has valuable knowledge of the subject material and speaking for myself I was eager to learn from but that perceived angst disrupted the learning process.
I really enjoyed the class and the discussions. I'm glad I have a better understanding of how theaters are laid out.
